meta.title: Use of Emergency Eye Wash Station

sections.purpose: To provide immediate irrigation of eyes in case of exposure to chemicals, plant allergens, or dust.
sections.scope: Applicable to all personnel working in the Pharmacognosy laboratory.
procedure: Familiarize all users with the location and operation of the eye wash station.
In case of eye exposure, activate the eye wash by pushing the handle or foot pedal.
Hold eyelids open with fingers and position eyes in the water stream.
Flush continuously for at least 15 minutes, rolling the eyes to ensure thorough rinsing.
Seek medical attention immediately after rinsing.
Report the incident and document it as per institutional policy.
precautions: Ensure the eye wash station is unobstructed and accessible at all times.
Test the station weekly to verify proper flow and cleanliness.
Do not use the eye wash for purposes other than emergency flushing.
Maintain protective caps on nozzles to prevent contamination.
Follow manufacturer and safety guidelines for maintenance and inspection.
